title: Enough about Dunkey.
body:
Let talks about that Malphite.
What a fucking legend,  he single handedly removed Dunkey from League of Legends and got tons of Dunkey's fanboys crying over the internet.
http://www.auplod.com/u/laodup622b5.png

Edit: Seem like he's back, all his fanboys got their panties in a bunch for no reason.
What a bunch of ass clowns.

Sincerely,
http://www.auplod.com/u/auopld60eff.png

replies.body: He deserves the ban, it doesn't matter if he has been promoting the game for 4 years his fanboys crying wont make him unbanned

He does deserve the ban.

But I'm personally waiting for Riot to actually acknowledge his video and possibly leave an article on it. That would be the first time they ever mention him, and they could hit home the message of "It doesn't matter who you are, if you're salty, you get banned."

> [{quoted}](name=Revlak Javik,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-09-13T04:04:27.047+0000)
>
> He does deserve the ban.
> 
> But I'm personally waiting for Riot to actually acknowledge his video and possibly leave an article on it. That would be the first time they ever mention him, and they could hit home the message of "It doesn't matter who you are, if you're salty, you get banned."

They don't need to, they even banned their own pro players for being toxic, you think they give a flying fuck about a youtuber?
I've been supported their game for many years cause of that reason.


http://www.auplod.com/u/auopld60eff.png

Oh, and how many players did the pro players bring into the game? none? k. Dunkey brought hundreds of thousands of people, including me, into league of legends, and bringing riot some business? and you're telling me that riot is too cool now and bans dunkey without hesitation because they already have a lot of fans thanks to dunkey. so fuck you and riot

Uh, Dunkey has been getting chat restrictions for years, dude is a Grade A jerk to people, he's been getting preferential treatment for years because if anyone saw his summoner name in the Tribunal they let him slide because he was popular. Now the Tribunal is gone and lookie here, Dunkey finally gets banned for having been a jerk to every other person he met in game for 4 years.

It's a 5 day ban, that's light considering that's the ban you get for leaving too many games if your internet provider decided to crap itself for a few days. Dunkey needs the time to cool down anyway, Riot will be done unbanning him 5 days after it was in place, I'll let you show yourself out.

> [{quoted}](name=BIAKaboose,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=00010001000000000001,timestamp=2015-09-13T11:58:12.402+0000)
>
> Uh, Dunkey has been getting chat restrictions for years, dude is a Grade A jerk to people, he's been getting preferential treatment for years because if anyone saw his summoner name in the Tribunal they let him slide because he was popular. Now the Tribunal is gone and lookie here, Dunkey finally gets banned for having been a jerk to every other person he met in game for 4 years.
> 
> It's a 5 day ban, that's light considering that's the ban you get for leaving too many games if your internet provider decided to crap itself for a few days. Dunkey needs the time to cool down anyway, Riot will be done unbanning him 5 days after it was in place, I'll let you show yourself out.

we could just copy paste this everywhere there's a dunkey post that should solve the problem

That is no excuse, and I am saying that as a Dunkey sort-of fan. CEOs have been kicked out of their own companies for doing stupid things, like sexually harassing their employees.

I made a thread some months back about when it's okay to be an asshole. Simply put, it's never okay, no matter if you're a bottom tier player or an LCS champion. I've experienced in real life the consequences of a loose tongue; consequences that led to one person's mind snapping like a banjo string, a head injury that landed me in the hospital and being taken out of school for my own safety. It made me very conscious about what I say and how. 

One the major problems with people nowadays is their lack of control over their own language, and it's an issue that goes beyond Dunkey. I've been around people who regularly drop F and N bombs like it's London 1940, make death threats and character attacks as general banter, or just plain old don't spell correctly. Language is one of the few ways we are perceived over the internet, and it is the most common way, more common than all the Twitch and Youtube videos combined, and it's one of two ways we're perceived over a game of League. There's already enough toxicity and negativity in League; it's not Riot, but the community that has created this atmosphere, and one that has made me consider leaving too many times. 

Much like real life, if you start being a bastard, you're going to be put in the timeout room for a while. You may not like it; tough! It's called discipline, and too few of us possess even one iota of it, be it behavioral or linguistic.

If trashtalking is illegal, then count me out. League is made for people to trashtalk as hard as they can. It is well known for it's toxic and savage players, and that's not such a bad thing ITS MAKING THE GAME MORE FUN, NOT DESTROYING IT. Although there's a difference between being an asshole in real life, and being one (playfully) in a game of league. Nothing is personal, Dunkey quit because League has become such a pussy game, where there's trolls everywhere and theres nothing you can do or say about it, or you get banned. The thing is, that Malphite is still playing league and trolling with no consequences, and that's why I quit. The system is so stupid, that it seems to FAVOR trolls and afk's, and the actual players who really want to play a serious and legitimate game of league seem to be at a disadvantage. I have gotten permanently banned for this reason. I just couldn't seem to find a game where there are no afk's and trolls on my team or the enemy team. I got frustrated and flamed our troll teamate, and he simply told lies about me on the enemy team and screenshot my chat and got me banned. This game is not worth the stress, and not worth my damn time.

It's become self-evident that you, Dunkey and most of the community don't know what trash talking is, and it goes back to my point on linguistic discipline. You want examples of trash talking? Hit Ctrl+2 next time you're in game. Hell, I trash talk.

"Come here, little moth, and dance upon the flame of my blade!"

*Talking to the enemy jungler if I'm crushing my lane* "Lee Sin, when are you going to come gank?"

*Killing a tower diver* "Let that be a lesson to you. BACK OFF."

*Shutting down a fed champion* "Shut up."

It stops being trash talking when you incite real violence against people. That's what Dunkey did, and that's what got him banned. It's insane that nobody else sees this.

Actually, they banned NA players.

The Korean servers are notoriously toxic to the point that Imp is infamous for basically telling people that he hopes their families get cancer just because they gave first blood.

The reason nothing's done about it is because a.) they're corrupt and b.) they probably also realize it's the Internet and a game where you are disproportionately tied to your teammates actions, so there's going to be some heated moments when you're forced to rely on somebody intentionally backstabbing you.

> [{quoted}](name=For Carthage,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0001000100000001,timestamp=2015-09-13T07:26:19.635+0000)
>
> Actually, they banned NA players.
> 
> The Korean servers are notoriously toxic to the point that Imp is infamous for basically telling people that he hopes their families get cancer just because they gave first blood.
> 
> The reason nothing's done about it is because a.) they're corrupt and b.) they probably also realize it's the Internet and a game where you are disproportionately tied to your teammates actions, so there's going to be some heated moments when you're forced to rely on somebody intentionally backstabbing you.

I understand, I used to play WC3 and got backstabbed in 4v4 all the time and it can be really frustrated sometime.
 I original made this thread to see how many people will downvotes me since they flood this forum with Dunkey threads every fucking second. 
These people take shit over the internet too serious. Notice some kid in here even insulted my mom for making a thread about his favorite youtuber and I'm here just laugh it off lol.


http://www.auplod.com/u/auopld60eff.png

Some people really attach themselves to Dunkey.  Others I know are only making a point of it because it's, once again, a game-ruining troll vs. a shit-talking kid on the Internet moment.  And while the shit-talking can get intense and hurtful, they don't even know you, so taking their shit personally is idiotic - in fact, usually if I've ever retaliated to people like that, it's for the sole reason of "Fuck that guy, he's a douchecock".  It's such a fluxing medium of personality that taking anything said towards you as a permanent statement is almost insane.
But flip to trying to enjoy yourself on the beach and some kid just runs up and kicks over your sandcastle just because he can - that's what those kinds of trolls are.  They're ruining a fun time just because, and that's about the only reason I can sympathize with the events at all - not because of a YouTuber, but because it's another player that flamed somebody kicking their sandcastle and mommy Riot ran up and said, "How could you say that? He's just a little boy! Apologize to the little boy! Now go in time-out."

Granted, I wouldn't have told the kid to get gunned down, but I've been reported enough times for telling somebody to just fuck off after they keep trolling and been chat banned for it that I'm willing to take the time to say, "Get your shit together, Riot." It's an over-policing of the entirely wrong area.

I don't think Riot is obligated to publicly acknowledge it, but I do this they would benefit from it. A lot of people seem pretty worked up about (there are like 5 threads about it on the first page of the boards). It's kinda a rare opportunity for them to send a message to the players about their stance on toxicity.

Personally, I think Dunkey probably deserved it if he was just flaming people seriously. But honestly if he like started his games with something like "Hey guys I'm kinda an asshole. I'm gonna trash talk. Don't take it personally." that would take the edge off the toxicity it and still let him get the footage he needs. I wouldn't ban him for that. The problem is if he's raging at someone who doesn't know who he is, and they take the insults seriously; which has probably happened a lot so... yeah, reported and banned.

> [{quoted}](name=COOLGUYRICH,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-13T03:12:04.773+0000)
>
> He deserves the ban, it doesn't matter if he has been promoting the game for 4 years his fanboys crying wont make him unbanned

Thank you Rich for supporting the legend aka Malphite.
Rock Fucking Solid.


http://www.auplod.com/u/auopld60eff.png

Thats 4 years of a mans life, put into promoting a video game, and they just ban him without hesitation, think about that, I'm no fan, but I think thats pretty fucked up. I guess Riot is just as savage as the rest of us

Damn boy, 4 comments in a row, you're on fire tonight baby.

Damnnnnn!!!! I'll need to collect all 7 dragon balls just to come back from this insult.

You realize it's not a ban right? He's suspended for 2 weeks and can come back but he said he's been bored with the game. He finds editing videos more fun.

> [{quoted}](name=AngusBoomPants,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=00010003,timestamp=2015-09-13T08:40:41.250+0000)

He is banned from the game for two weeks.

> [{quoted}](name=COOLGUYRICH,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=000100030000,timestamp=2015-09-13T16:48:18.436+0000)
>
> He is banned from the game for two weeks.

A ban is forever, suspension is temporary

> [{quoted}](name=AngusBoomPants,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0001000300000000,timestamp=2015-09-13T19:52:00.029+0000)
>
> A ban is forever, suspension is temporary

No. That information is false.

Suspension and ban, depending on the situation, are one in the same.
The definition of a ban is to officially or legally prohibit, so that can happen for a temporary duration or permanently.

> [{quoted}](name=COOLGUYRICH,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-13T03:12:04.773+0000)

words dont hurt people people need to sack up and learn that just because someone says toxic crap doesnt mean your entitled to not get your feelings hurt thats why there is a mute button. 

meanwhile feeders and afks waste my time sjw and worthless piles like you make this world a horrible one to live in
to quote a supreme court justice "the right to swing my fist ends where the other mans nose begins" 
notice it says  _**NOSE**_  not  **_FEELINGS_**

I've been play this game call "League of Legends" for years but I only saw champions in this game, today I finally witness a true legend {{champion:54}}.

http://www.auplod.com/u/auopld60eff.png
Why is it an insult to have fanboys? I would take that as a compliment
fanboys =/= fans

While Dunkey might be deserving of a ban.. Keep in mind Riot has generally shown a lack of gratitude to youtubers who make their game popular. Remember TotalBiscut, he was almost singlehandedly responsible for LoL's initial surge in popularity, and based on the refferal system he was supposed to get a lot more than a conditional consumable item named after him.

Both Malphite and Dunkey deserves to be banned imo.
I liked Dunkey, but the atrocities he said to that Malphite, that I don't protect because he's a **** too, were worth a permaban.
I heard death wishes were treated with permabans, so dunkey only having a one week ban is nice from Riot.
I didn't know who the hell he was... Saw the first 2 minutes of the spammed video... realized he is a toxic guy and the punishment was deserved.
I need to take a dunkey brb

Ah, I quite like his "Dunk Souls" and "Top 100 Games" videos, other than that I barely know who he is. Shame.

Dunno if he actually deserves the ban or not, I am gonna be neutral here atm.

**EDIT:** It seems to me he did something which got him banned, while he has been League's promoter for many years? Correct me if I got the memo wrong. Tbh, I would say doesn't matter if you're a long time supporter or not, one shouldn't break rules to the point of being banned. And it's precisely that you're a lover of LoL you would know the rules better than most people. But what do I know?

I just wanna see Lyte come in and go for an epic smite onto all the fanboys. 

Plz Lyte.

> [{quoted}](name=TurquoiseYoshi,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-09-13T05:03:19.889+0000)
>
> I just wanna see Lyte come in and go for an epic smite onto all the fanboys. 
> 
> Plz Lyte.

And the fanboys want to see Lyte come in and go for the smite onto the "haters" and make a statement about people who promote the game.

The neutral people want to see Lyte come in, go for the smite onto the board spammers, and make a statement about the Malphite and their stance on toxic players/intentional feeders.

No matter what side they take, I think a lot of people would want to see Lyte on the boards, once s/he or Riot has a stance on the issue.
lyte is a guy

> [{quoted}](name=BeatinWarDrumz,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2015-09-13T18:20:10.999+0000)

> lyte is a guy

Yes, that is why i put a slash between the S and the H. 
S/he is a shortened version of "he or she", since I wasn't sure xD
You wanna know what's worse than dunkey fanboys? People calling a feeder and a troll a legend.

> [{quoted}](name=A Cloud,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0015,timestamp=2015-09-13T14:47:51.260+0000)

Nor does it make it suddenly okay for a jerk to be pardoned by his past actions. He talked shit and he got hit. plain and simple.

> [{quoted}](name=Tesla Effect,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=0015000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-13T15:24:56.419+0000)

I dont mean to respond so late but I would like to point out I never said I wanted him pardoned, I just think we shouldn't herald this dude as a legend for purposely feeding and trolling.
haha Thanks Riot Now we know we can troll and intentionally feed w/o getting banned XD
A CHAMPION IS LEGENDARY!!! {{champion:54}}

People fail to realize that if people like that malaphite were getting banned like they should this wouldn't of happened. Okay sure dunkey raged whatever it's what he does ban him if you will but ban that other dude too.

Honestly this is probably the most overlooked issue right now. People point the finger at the ragers when there are people like that malphite in over abundance. 

Now I'm not trying to say raging is okay but cmon it has personally happened to me in 3 of the last 5 ranked games, sure maybe I'm unlucky but that's downright insane.Treat the problem not the symptoms.

> [{quoted}](name=HashtagRenzo,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=RH7HoW1f,comment-id=002f,timestamp=2015-09-25T23:02:24.347+0000)
>

> 
> Honestly this is probably the most overlooked issue right now. People point the finger at the ragers when there are people like that malphite in over abundance. 
> 
> Now I'm not trying to say raging is okay but cmon it has personally happened to me in 3 of the last 5 ranked games, sure maybe I'm unlucky but that's downright insane.Treat the problem not the symptoms.

Its not overlooked at all. There was an update to intentional feeder detection on PBE when the dunkey thing happened and it has since been released.

While trolls may set off people like dunkey, if people likely dunkey wouldn't take the bait then a lot of trolls wouldn't exist. Raging at trolls is giving them exactly what they want. Its like giving a puppy a treat every time it shits on the carpet.
